channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Students react to Charlie Kirk's killing and discuss their desire for more dialogue
item.description: Utah State University students, where Charlie Kirk was supposed to speak at the end of the month, respond to the governor's plea to disagree constructively.

item.title: The man accused of killing Charlie Kirk is being held without bail
item.description: The man accused of killing Charlie Kirk is being held without bail in a Utah jail. Steve Futterman has the latest on the investigation.

item.title: How millions of dollars in funding cuts will impact Hispanic Serving Institutions
item.description: Chancellor Sonya Christian of the California Community College system talks about the impact of funding cuts for students.

item.title: David Bowie fans can explore his legacy at an unusual new archive in London
item.description: A new exhibition in London shares David Bowie's archive, tracing his personas and evolution as a musician and artist.

item.title: President Trump's responses on political violence over time
item.description: NPR's Tamara Keith examines President Trump's response to the Charlie Kirk assassination along with his reaction to a 2017 political shooting and other moments of political violence.

item.title: The impact of war told through the words of a child
item.description: A child injured in an airstrike in Gaza gave a reporter the words to express the full impact of war.

item.title: The Supreme Court clears the way for ICE agents to treat race as grounds for immigration stops
item.description: As ICE immigration enforcement intensifies across the country, a Supreme Court ruling permits racial profiling as grounds for immigration stops.

item.title: Half-court 'heaves' in the NBA will now count against the team
item.description: Starting this season, shot attempts taken more than 36 feet from the basket will be counted against the team, not the player. These NBA "freebies" have drawn all types of reactions.

item.title: Authorities have identified and arrested the man they say killed Charlie Kirk
item.description: President Trump announced that the man who authorities say shot and killed conservative activist Charlie Kirk has been arrested. Investigators identified him as 22-year-old Tyler Robinson.

item.title: Bolsonaro's meteoric rise, his stunning fall and what it means for Brazil's far right
item.description: Brazil's former President Jair Bolsonaro was sentenced to 27 years in prison for attempting a coup. Yet the former president remains one of the country's most consequential figures.
